layout.description: This notes the general layout. Use 'flexfolio' for more flexibility, or use 'photofolio' for a stricter (deprecated) layout.

description.description: A description of the client. This is usually taken from their website so I don't need to actually write something myself.

code.description: The client code. Usually used in billing, and typically 2-3 characters long.

color.description: The client's main color. Usually used in image backgrounds in case study posts.

category.description: The main category/section the item is in. Upon updating my sites to be separated between different audiences, this property will more closely resemble the current subcategory property.

img-base.description: Images for this project will be prepended with the value of this property.

last-update.description: When the page was last updated.

time.description: The time the client was active.

stack.description: The tech stack used. Eventually, I'd like to convert this to being an array so autocomplete is easier.

responsibilities.description: Responsibilities I had during the project.

location.description: The location the project took place. Usually used for photography.

subcategory.description: Single string shared by other items.

casestudy.description: This will determine if a unique page for this client is linked to or not. If false (default), then a link will not be generated to the separate page.

technical-class.description: This will be used as a CSS class in Technical blocks and can be used to style these sections differently.

name.description: The name of this team member. Example: 'Emily Serven'

role.description: The role of this team member. Example: 'Web Developer, Project Manager'

url.description: The URL for the website of the team member.
